result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacquon L Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of A Firearm By A Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber release for work and childcare to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute sobriety.

DNA sample.
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA during the term of probation or is subject to a civil judgment and/or tax intercept.

No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription and follow instructions.
No contact with L.T.H. unless permitted by the agent.
No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED AND STAYED: to be used at the discretion of the agent.  Huber release for work and childcare to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center.

defendant.name: Hall, Jacquon L

records.addlTxt: See Order appointing counsel for specific monthly due dates for this pending ATTYF case # 2022CF001544.  Bond will be held in the AFTES account to be applied towards attorney fees upon receipt of the attorney's Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs Due form.

Defendant Jacquon L Hall in court.  Attorney John Alexander Cabranes in court for Jacquon L Hall.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting  

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served. Huber release for work and child care to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation. 

Conditions of Probation:
- 60 DAYS condition time imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent. Huber release for work and child care to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- DNA sample.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription and follow instructions.
- No contact with LTH unless permitted by the agent.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
- Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA) during the term of probation or is subject to a civil judgment and/or tax intercept.

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Plea addendum, filed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Jacquon L Hall in court.  Attorney Brandon Zegiel in court on behalf of John Alexander Cabranes for Jacquon L Hall.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jacquon L Hall in court with attorney John Alexander Cabranes in court by Brandon Zegiel.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requested more time to review discovery.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report received and filed.

Defendant Jacquon L Hall in court late Atty John Cabranes unable to appear due to another hearing in Kenosha County Family Court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court withdraws stayed Bench Warrant.   Court ordered case adjourned for status in Branch 25. Status Conference calendared for 7/25/22 at 8:30 am.

Attorney John Alexander Cabranes in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 11:00 am. If defendant fails to appear by 11:00 am court will issue a Bench Warrant.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jacquon L Hall in court, appear by video with attorney John Alexander Cabranes, appear in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated May 20, 2022 - received

Defendant Jacquon L Hall in court by video with Attorney John Alexander Cabranes who appears in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney needs more time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

-  signed by the Court (electronically)

Defendant Jacquon L Hall in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Statements by the Defendant.  Based upon review of the Defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the Defendant is indigent and does qualify for representation at the County's expense. Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Attorney John Cabranes to represent defendant at the rate of $100 per hour;  Attorney Cabranes present in court and accepted the appointment. 

Court ordered Defendant to contribute to legal expenses at a rate of  $100 per month upon conclusion of this case.  All payments should be made directly to the Clerk of Courts Office.  Case remains scheduled for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Order Appointing Counsel to be forwarded to the court for Judge's signature.  Copies to be mailed to the parties.
